home.description: Junior web developer passionate about technology and digital experiences. I quickly adapt to new environments and enjoy working in teams. I'm driven by turning ideas into attractive web solutions, always with enthusiasm and dedication.

cv.aboutme.description:
Passionate about technology from an early age, I studied a Vocational Training in Microcomputer Systems and Networks, and later a Higher Degree in Multiplatform Application Development, where I learned Java, SQL, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. I later expanded my profile as a 3D artist and animator, combining this with freelance work in Angular application development for a foreign company.

Currently, I specialize in Frontend development with HTML, CSS, TypeScript, and Angular, leveraging tools like GitHub Copilot to boost productivity. I'm known for adaptability, teamwork, and a constant initiative to keep learning and face new challenges.

angularweb.description3: Implementation of responsive design throughout the application, following the Mobile First methodology
angularweb.description4: Building dynamic forms and advanced validations using Reactive Forms and custom Validators
angularweb.description5: Consumption of RESTful APIs through HttpClient, including error handling
angularweb.description6: Integration with serverless functions (Vercel) and use of asynchronous logic (async/await) to display data in interactive and accessible interfaces
angularweb.description7: Version control with Git (GitHub), code reviews, and development of unit tests with Jasmine/Karma

wow.name: WoW Project
wow.description: This WoW Guild project is an application that integrates Angular and serverless functions on Vercel to manage and display a World of Warcraft guild roster in real time. It fetches up-to-date data via Blizzard’s API, highlights key members like Drakiria and Chumari, and sorts the rest by mScore. The Blizzard API calls are handled with Promise.all and chained calls due to its HATEOAS architecture. The app combines a serverless backend with a modern frontend to deliver a dynamic and effective experience for WoW fans.

pokedex.name: Pokedex Project
pokedex.description: An application that consumes data from the PokeAPI through a serverless function on Vercel. It displays the original 151 Pokémon in an interactive and accessible table, allowing users to open a modal with detailed information about each one.

form.name: Form
form.description: This project is an accessible form that validates entered data and stores it in either sessionStorage or localStorage depending on user selection. It then checks whether the stored data is still valid and displays it as cards. Each card includes a button to easily delete that entry.
